void metal_finish_threads(int threads, void *tids)
{
	int i;

	if (!tids) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "invalid argument, tids is NULL.\n");

		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create producer thread: %d.\n",

	metal_finish_threads(THREADS, (void *)tids);

	ret = metal_run_noblock(THREADS, producer_thread, NULL, tids,

		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create consumer thread: %d.\n",

		goto out;

	/** create 10 consumer threads next */
	ret = metal_run(THREADS, consumer_thread, NULL);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create producer thread: %d.\n",

		goto out;

out:

	metal_finish_threads(THREADS, (void *)tids);

int metal_run_noblock(int threads, metal_thread_t child,
		     void *arg, void *tids, int *threads_out)
{
	int error, i;
	pthread_t *tid_p = (pthread_t *)tids;

	if (!tids) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "invalid argument, tids is NULL.\n");
		return -EINVAL;
	}

	error = 0;
	for (i = 0; i < threads; i++) {
		error = -pthread_create(&tid_p[i], NULL, child, arg);
		if (error) {
			metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "failed to create thread - %s\n",
				  strerror(error));
			break;
		}
	}

	*threads_out = i;
	return error;
}

{
	const int threads = 10;
	atomic_int counter = ATOMIC_VAR_INIT(0);
	int value, error;

	error = metal_run(threads, atomic_thread, &counter);
	if (!error) {
		value = atomic_load(&counter);
		value -= atomic_test_count * threads;
		if (value) {
			metal_log(METAL_LOG_DEBUG, "counter mismatch, delta = %d\n",
				  value);
			error = -EINVAL;
		}
	}

	return error;
}

explanation: No direct self-calls are visible in the provided code fragments (none of the shown functions call themselves). The only locations that could enable indirect recursion are the sites that create threads using a function pointer (the 'child' parameter passed to pthread_create in metal_run_noblock) and the call sites that invoke metal_run/metal_run_noblock/metal_finish_threads. Therefore those call sites and the thread-creation/join code are reported for investigation. Other code in the snippets (local variable declarations, error checks, logging, arithmetic, pthread_join usage itself) does not indicate a function calling itself or forming a call cycle and so does not need investigation with respect to MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2. Note: to complete the recursion check you must inspect the implementations of the thread entry-point functions (consumer_thread, producer_thread, atomic_thread, spinlock_thread, etc.) which are not included here; if any of those call back into metal_run/metal_run_noblock/metal_finish_threads (directly or through other functions), an indirect recursion cycle could exist.
